t: Psalm 88
A Song or Psalm for the sons of Korah, to the chief Musician upon Mahalath Leannoth, Maschil of Heman the Ezrahite.
O*p Lord*s God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:
Let*p my prayer come before thee: incline thine ear unto my cry;
For*p my soul is full of troubles: and my life draweth nigh unto the grave.
I*p am counted with them that go down into the pit: I am as a man that hath no strength:
Free*p among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand.
Thou*p hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.
Thy*p wrath lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.
Thou*p hast put away mine acquaintance far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.
Mine*p eye mourneth by reason of affliction: Lord,*s I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched out my hands unto thee.
Wilt*p thou shew wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise and praise thee? Selah.
Shall*p thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?
Shall*p thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
But*p unto thee have I cried, O Lord;*s and in the morning shall my prayer prevent thee.
Lord,*sp why castest thou off my soul? why hidest thou thy face from me?
I*p am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up: while I suffer thy terrors I am distracted.
Thy*p fierce wrath goeth over me; thy terrors have cut me off.
They*p came round about me daily like water; they compassed me about together.
Lover*p and friend hast thou put far from me, and mine acquaintance into darkness.
